question_title: How many vehicles will Tesla deliver globally in Q1 2026?
summary: Tesla Q1 2026 deliveries should recover from the depressed Q1 2025 (336,681) when Model Y changeover disrupted production, but remain below Q1 2024 (386,810) due to persistent regional demand weakness. Europe fell 28% in 2025, China down 7%, and the US lost the $7,500 EV tax credit in September 2025. The Kalshi prediction market implies a median of ~330,000 vehicles, while Barclays estimates ~350,000. I weight slightly above market consensus due to the Model Y changeover headwind being removed. Manifold gives only 38% probability that 2026 deliveries exceed 2025, reflecting overall bearish sentiment on Tesla's vehicle business.

factors.description: Model Y changeover headwind removed: Q1 2025 (336,681) was abnormally depressed by global Model Y refresh disruption. Q1 2026 should see normalized production.
Regional demand weakness persists: Europe down 28%, China down 7% in 2025. BYD overtook Tesla as #1 EV seller. These structural headwinds continue.
US EV tax credit expired Sept 2025: $7,500 federal credit removal reduces US demand; no policy reversal expected.
Kalshi market prices: Well-informed market implies median ~330,000. 83% probability above 300k, only 9% above 380k.
Barclays analyst estimate ~350,000: Represents 10% drop from Q1 2024, reflecting partial recovery from Q1 2025.
Tesla China 0% financing promotion: January 2026 stimulus could boost China demand, but competition remains intense.
